[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Constant: EMIT_FEE_STATEMENT] [Fee reporting manipulation] If EMIT_FEE_STATEMENT constant is compromised, can attackers manipulate fee reporting to hide actual transaction costs, affecting gas economics and validator compensation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Constant: EMIT_FEE_STATEMENT] [Event emission bypass] Does the VM enforce that EMIT_FEE_STATEMENT is only callable during transaction epilogue, or can attackers call it directly to emit fraudulent fee statements and manipulate on-chain analytics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [All Modules] [Module resolution race] During parallel transaction execution, can race conditions in lazy static initialization cause different threads to resolve the same module name to different ModuleId instances, leading to non-deterministic execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [All Modules] [Core address validation] Does the code validate that account_config::CORE_CODE_ADDRESS (0x1) is consistent across all module definitions, or can address mismatches cause modules to be resolved from untrusted addresses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [All Modules] [Identifier injection] Can attackers inject null bytes or special characters into module identifiers through ident_str! macro exploitation, causing module resolution failures or security bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [All Constants] [Function name validation] Are function name constants validated against the actual Move framework code at compile time, or can mismatches between constants and deployed modules cause critical function call failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [All Constants] [IdentStr immutability] Does the IdentStr type guarantee immutability of function name constants, or can they be modified at runtime through unsafe code, redirecting system function calls to attacker-controlled functions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Integration] [VM initialization timing] Can attackers exploit the timing of lazy static initialization to cause system modules to be resolved before the VM is fully initialized, leading to undefined behavior or security bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Integration] [Module cache poisoning] If these constants are used to populate the VM's module cache, can attackers poison the cache with malicious modules before legitimate system modules are loaded? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Integration] [Function lookup bypass] When the VM uses these constants to look up system functions, are there path traversal or namespace collision vulnerabilities that could redirect calls to attacker-controlled functions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Integration] [Error propagation] If lazy static initialization fails for any module, does the VM properly propagate errors and halt execution, or can it continue with null/invalid module references causing crashes or exploits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Integration] [State consistency] During epoch transitions or reconfigurations, are these module constants re-validated against the new framework version, or can version mismatches cause state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Memory Safety] [Lazy static thread safety] Does the once_cell::sync::Lazy implementation guarantee thread-safe initialization across all architectures, or can weak memory ordering cause some threads to see uninitialized ModuleId instances? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Memory Safety] [Reference lifetime] Are the static references to ModuleId and IdentStr guaranteed to outlive all VM instances, or can use-after-free occur if the VM attempts to access these constants during shutdown? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Memory Safety] [Clone semantics] When ModuleId is cloned from these lazy statics, does the clone properly deep-copy all internal data, or can shallow copies lead to shared mutable state and race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Concurrency] [Initialization order] If multiple system modules are accessed concurrently during VM startup, can initialization order dependencies cause deadlocks or inconsistent module resolution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Attack: Account Takeover] Can an attacker who compromises ACCOUNT_MODULE or AUTHENTICATE constants gain unauthorized access to arbitrary accounts by redirecting authentication logic to a no-op function? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Attack: Consensus Manipulation] Can Byzantine validators exploit incorrect BLOCK_MODULE, BLOCK_PROLOGUE, or BLOCK_EPILOGUE constants to manipulate block validation and commit invalid state transitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Attack: Validator Set Manipulation] Can attackers exploit RECONFIGURATION_WITH_DKG_MODULE or FINISH_WITH_DKG_RESULT to inject malicious validators during epoch transitions by manipulating DKG results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Attack: Multisig Theft] Can incorrect MULTISIG_ACCOUNT_MODULE or VALIDATE_MULTISIG_TRANSACTION constants be exploited to drain multisig wallets by bypassing signature threshold requirements? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Attack: Fee Bypass] Can manipulation of TRANSACTION_FEE_MODULE or EMIT_FEE_STATEMENT allow attackers to execute unlimited transactions without paying fees, causing network resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Attack: Keyless Account Compromise] Can attackers exploit JWKS_MODULE or UPSERT_INTO_OBSERVED_JWKS to inject fraudulent JSON Web Keys and take over keyless accounts authenticated via OAuth providers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty module name] What happens if ident_str! macro is called with an empty string for a module name - does it cause panic, silent failure, or undefined module resolution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Edge Case] [Unicode handling] Can Unicode normalization issues in module or function names cause different threads to resolve different modules, breaking deterministic execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/system_module_names.rs] [Edge Case] [Module not found] If a system module doesn't exist at CORE_CODE_ADDRESS during VM execution, does the error handling properly halt execution or can it continue with undefined behavior? (High)
